info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Las Vegas, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Romeroville, Montezuma, Tecolote, Storrie Lake State Park, Sapello, Ojitos Frios, San Geronimo, Mineral Hill and San Pablo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 336 and 359. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
